# sleeping_angel - 165
**Description:** `Uto is cutest angel, but she seems to have fallen asleep. Could you wake her up?` 

**Attachments**: `Uto.eml`

**Hints:**

**Author:** `夜有夢`

---

we are given some `eml` named `Uto.eml`.  if i check the eml have 2 diferent attachments 

<img width="300" height="300" alt="image" src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4af03525-8f22-495a-ad26-2a97cac535c8" />

<img width="300" height="300" alt="image" src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3e018bb9-c80c-47ad-9467-1099c5cd067a" />

the first attachment is a html code and the second is SleepUto.jpg <- image attachment

i use cyberchef to get the html code because this string is base 64

[html]: https://gchq.github.io/CyberChef/#recipe=From_Base64('A-Za-z0-9%2B/%3D',true,false)&&oenc=65001

[html] <- first attact

<img width="600" height="600" alt="image" src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ef248463-4c2d-41f3-a5f1-517eadd7030e" />

and yap. thats the html code. after i analyze that i found some intresting string

<img width="200" height="112" alt="image" src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bae78781-c6c3-42fa-910c-c0a085657648" />

iyesss!! some base string again :)

<img width="266" height="229" alt="image" src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5d4b1d0c-68f8-4ccd-8418-d8cd6cc1b220" />

Actually, I was confused about what it meant, but everything was answered when I tried to decode the second attachment.

<img width="300" height="300" alt="image" src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a37a97dc-725b-467e-b505-b7f11e9d576e" />

<img width="300" height="142" alt="image" src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4ba16974-fd36-4a6c-9431-07b206908650" />

so kawaiii hhe. after so that i think this is a steganography. so i download it and i check use binwalk

<img width="1200" height="225" alt="image" src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d33ecfe7-194c-47b4-af29-9c89b80e4462" />

and yep thats have a zip file so i extract that

<img width="500" height="314" alt="image" src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3e74fb6d-e296-498c-9323-b94358d2a529" />

and i check that dir

<img width="593" height="92" alt="image" src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f268c079-9dbc-442e-9a37-f441f357567c" />

and yes I think it's true that the base string that we decoded earlier is the password for this zip, let's extract it

but it turned out the password was wrong. I continued analyzing the image and found the password using exiftool

<img width="500" height="400" alt="image" src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2b1d633c-4f68-4416-9a74-d50f2aac5ca1" />

then i use that for the zip pass

<img width="500" height="100" alt="image" src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/46c5e5b3-adda-4735-91d7-7863950c0d6f" />

and thats work. next i think the string base pw is use for this image lets extract use steghide

<img width="792" height="210" alt="image" src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0baeeeeb-630d-4ee3-9fe1-0bf8f5d816a3" />

thast work and yeahhh finaly get the flag
